escalate: When ESC during the weekend/late Friday use the "Weekend escalation template" template
tone: Don't use the term "customer service team", use "customer care" instead
dos_and_donts: Do not direct cx to contact the carrier
Do not provide customers with dates for restock before checking with our team.
promo_and_exclusions: They have only 2 sales per year (June/November) - when those end the sale items are removed from the site

conversation.message_text: Julie Vos: Welcome to Julie Vos! Msg & data rates may apply. Msg frequency varies. Reply HELP for help, STOP to cancel. Privacy: attnl.tv/p/N9l
Julie Vos: Hey this is Rebecca , how can I help you?

Julie Vos: Oh, also, a lot of people like getting personal recs from us. Over the next few days we'll try to help you find something that you will love.

In the meantime, check out our newest arrivals > https://julievos.attn.tv/aUNx3BLpmpZ5 .
I purchased a JV bracelet at Christmas and the stones have started falling out. What should I do? I use many many of your pieces and have never had a problem before

Julie Vos: Thank you so much for reaching out, and I'm really sorry to hear about this issue. I understand how disappointing it must be, especially since you've purchased and enjoyed many of our pieces without any problems before. We truly appreciate your loyalty.

The best next step is to review our warranty policy, which you can find here: https://julievos.attn.tv/aLYXZc8t3zGU

For assistance with your JV bracelet, please email our customer care team at customercare@julievos.com and include the following so they can help you as quickly as possible:

Proof of purchase, such as your order number
Your name, email address, and order number
Clear images of the damaged bracelet
A brief description of what you are requesting, such as a repair or replacement

Once they receive this information, the team will guide you through the next steps. Please don't hesitate to reach back out if you need help putting this together or have any other questions.
